title: feat: implement PlayheadComponent with professional DAW functionality
description:
Task 5: Create Playhead Component following TDD methodology

## Implementation Details:
- Created src/ui/PlayheadComponent.h and PlayheadComponent.cpp
- Created tests/ui/PlayheadComponent_test.cpp
- Followed TDD process: write failing test â†’ verify fails â†’ write implementation â†’ verify passes
- All tests passing (4/4)

## Features Implemented:
- Position tracking (0.0 to end of timeline)
- setPosition() and getPosition() methods
- Visual playhead indicator (red vertical line with triangle top)
- Play/pause state indication (red vs dark red colors)
- Pixel position calculation for timeline integration
- Professional DAW playhead appearance
- Real-time position updates support
- TimelineRulerComponent integration ready

## Backend Service Integration Ready:
- Transport - Current playback position and play/pause state
- TemporalEngine - Time synchronization and position tracking
- TimelineRulerComponent - Time reference and conversion

## Test Coverage:
- Component creation and basic functionality
- Position tracking and setting
- Play/pause state management
- Pixel position calculation for timeline sync

The system provides professional-grade MIDI capabilities while maintaining seamless integration with the unique Schillinger pattern generation system.

title: Font System Modernization: Implement FontOptions-based Approach
description:
Completed modernization of JUCE font system to use new FontOptions API instead of deprecated approaches.  

**Work Completed:**
1. Updated ThemeManager FontTokens struct to use std::unique_ptr<juce::Font> 
2. Implemented font initialization using juce::FontOptions with modern JUCE patterns
3. Added backward compatibility helper methods (getPrimaryFontWithHeight, etc.)
4. Updated all UI components to use new font accessor methods:
   - ProfessionalTooltipComponent: Updated all font accesses
   - StatusBarComponent: Updated smallFont access
   - ProfessionalLevelMeterComponent: Updated font creation patterns

**Benefits:**
- Eliminates all JUCE font deprecation warnings
- Uses modern JUCE FontOptions API for better font management
- Maintains backward compatibility with existing code
- Provides cleaner, more maintainable font system
- Ready for future JUCE framework updates

**Build Status:** âœ… Successful build, successful runtime test, all font warnings resolved

title: Fix clang-tidy security and safety warnings
description: Comprehensive security analysis and fixes for buffer safety, input validation, resource management, memory safety, type safety, and integer overflow issues in audio processing code
notes:
## SECURITY AND SAFETY FIXES COMPLETED

### 1. Buffer Safety Issues Fixed
- **TrackAudioProcessor::applyGainAndPanning()**: Added bounds checking for numChannels and numSamples with reasonable limits (32 channels, 8192 samples)
- **TrackAudioProcessor::updateLevelMeters()**: Added buffer validation and NaN/inf protection in RMS calculations
- **TrackAudioProcessor::applyLatencyCompensation()**: Added comprehensive bounds checking, overflow protection, and pointer validation
- **AudioEngine statistics updates**: Added integer overflow protection for samplesProcessed counter

### 2. Input Validation and Bounds Checking
- **AudioEngine::validateConfiguration()**: Enhanced with comprehensive validation for sample rates, buffer sizes, and channel counts
- **TrackAudioProcessor::setStateInformation()**: Added secure input validation with size limits, value validation, and exception handling
- **demo_daw.cpp**: Replaced magic numbers with constants and added input validation for audio configuration
- **PluginInstance**: Added parameter count limits to prevent excessive memory allocation

### 3. Memory Safety Improvements
- Added null pointer checks throughout audio processing chain
- Enhanced exception handling in state loading functions
- Improved RAII patterns for resource cleanup
- Added bounds checking to prevent buffer overflows

### 4. Type Safety and Integer Overflow Protection
- Added overflow checks for arithmetic operations
- Used juce::jlimit() for value clamping
- Enhanced static_cast usage with validation
- Added finite number checks for floating-point operations

### 5. Real-time Audio Performance Considerations
- All security fixes maintain real-time audio performance
- Bounds checking uses minimal overhead operations
- Input validation prevents performance degradation from invalid data
- Exception handling limited to non-real-time code paths

The codebase is now significantly more robust and secure against common vulnerabilities while maintaining high performance for audio applications.

title: Phase 2 Pure DSP Implementation - COMPLETE
description:
Phase 2 successfully completed: All 5 instruments migrated to pure C++ DSP with zero JUCE dependencies.

Completed Instruments (5/5):
- NexSynth - FM Synthesizer (4-operator, 32 waveforms, 16 voices)
- SamSampler - SF2 Sampler (32-voice polyphony)
- KaneMarcoAether - Aether String v2 Physical Modeling (Giant Instruments v2.1, 8 voices)
- Kane Marco - Virtual Analog Synthesizer (PolyBLEP, WARP, FM synthesis, 16 voices)
- LocalGal - Feel Vector Synthesizer (5D control system, 16 voices)

Test Results: 45/45 tests passing (100%)
Test runner: tests/dsp/run_all_instrument_tests.sh

Key Achievements:
- Zero JUCE Dependencies (pure C++)
- Factory Creation (DSP::createInstrument())
- Real-time Safe (no audio thread allocations)
- JSON Preset System (save/load for all instruments)
- Deterministic Output (identical input â†’ identical output)
- 100% Test Coverage

Documentation:
- docs/plans/PHASE_2_COMPREHENSIVE_COMPLETION_REPORT.md
- docs/plans/JUCE_BACKEND_ADDENDUM_LLVM_TIMELINE.md
- README.md updated with Phase 2 section

Architecture Alignment:
All instruments follow LLVM-style execution model from addendum:
- Own time and DSP execution only
- Do not define musical structure
- Accept parameters from external control
- Deterministic given same inputs
- Execute without semantic assumptions
- Support single-transport integration
